Package kaitech.api.database

Interface InventoryTable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InventoryTblImpl
    public interface InventoryTable
    The InventoryTable interface declares required functionality to store, retrieve, and modify ingredients and their quantity in the database.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllStockCodes()
      Get the codes of all ingredients currently in stock.
      java.lang.Integer getIngredientQuantity​(Ingredient ingredient)
      Retrieves an ingredient's quantity in stock from the cache.
      default java.lang.Integer getOrAddQuantity​(Ingredient from)
      From a given Ingredient, gets the quantity.
      void putInventory​(Ingredient ingredient, int quantity)
      Saves a given ingredient and its quantity to the database, assuming that the ingredient already exists in the ingredients table.
      void removeInventory​(Ingredient ingredient)
      Remove an ingredient and its quantity from the database and cache.
      java.util.Map<Ingredient,​java.lang.Integer> resolveInventory()
      Gets all ingredients and their quantities from the database, given the ingredients table.
      void setQuantity​(Ingredient ingredient, int newAmt)
      Directly set the quantity of the ingredient in the inventory table.
      void updateQuantities​(java.util.Map<MenuItem,​java.lang.Integer> itemsOrdered)
      Updates the inventory to remove the items used in the recipes of menu items from sales.
      void updateQuantity​(Ingredient ingredient, int change)
      Updates the given ingredient's quantity by the amount specified, which may be positive or negative.

    • Method Detail

      • getIngredientQuantity

        java.lang.Integer getIngredientQuantity​(Ingredient ingredient)
        Retrieves an ingredient's quantity in stock from the cache. If the ingredient does not currently exist in the cache, query the database for the quantity. If the query is successful, add the ingredient and its quantity to the cache and return it.
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The integer quantity of the ingredient in stock if it exists, null if it does not or cannot be retrieved.

      • getAllStockCodes

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllStockCodes()
        Get the codes of all ingredients currently in stock.
        Returns:
        A set of ingredient codes.

      • putInventory

        void putInventory​(Ingredient ingredient,
                  int quantity)
        Saves a given ingredient and its quantity to the database, assuming that the ingredient already exists in the ingredients table.
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to be saved.
        quantity - The quantity of the ingredient in stock.

      • removeInventory

        void removeInventory​(Ingredient ingredient)
        Remove an ingredient and its quantity from the database and cache.
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to be removed.

      • resolveInventory

        java.util.Map<Ingredient,​java.lang.Integer> resolveInventory()
        Gets all ingredients and their quantities from the database, given the ingredients table. Warning: this can be a costly operation when everything isn't already cached, please use with care.
        Returns:
        A map from Ingredient to integer quantity.

      • setQuantity

        void setQuantity​(Ingredient ingredient,
                 int newAmt)
        Directly set the quantity of the ingredient in the inventory table. Throws IllegalArgumentException if the amount is negative.
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to set the quantity of.
        newAmt - The new amount for the Ingredient.

      • updateQuantity

        void updateQuantity​(Ingredient ingredient,
                    int change)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Updates the given ingredient's quantity by the amount specified, which may be positive or negative. Throws IllegalArgumentException if the amount is negative and would result in the ingredient having a negative quantity.
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to update the quantity of.
        change - The signed integer amount to update the ingredient's quantity by.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • updateQuantities

        void updateQuantities​(java.util.Map<MenuItem,​java.lang.Integer> itemsOrdered)
        Updates the inventory to remove the items used in the recipes of menu items from sales.
        Parameters:
        itemsOrdered - A map of MenuItem to Integer, where the integer is the number of MenuItems sold. The ingredients required for each MenuItem will have their inventory quantity decreased by the appropriate amount.

      • getOrAddQuantity

        default java.lang.Integer getOrAddQuantity​(Ingredient from)
        From a given Ingredient, gets the quantity. If the ingredient does not exist in the inventory, add the ingredient with quantity 0.
        Parameters:
        from - The Ingredient to have its quantity retrieved or added.
        Returns:
        The Integer quantity of the ingredient.
